FuncDef:
The if-match l2vni command configures a matching rule based on a Layer 2 VNI list.
The undo if-match l2vni command cancels the configuration. The if-match l2vni command configures a matching rule based on a Layer 2 VNI list. The undo if-match l2vni command cancels the configuration. By default, no matching rule based on a Layer 2 VNI list is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a Layer 2 VNI list. If l2vni-list-name is not specified, a route is matched if only it carries Layer 2 VNI information.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: To configure a matching rule based on a Layer 2 VNI list, run the if-match l2vni command.
